item.title: Rishi Sunak Is Swimming Against the Tide on Taxes, Inflation
item.description: Rishi Sunak’s Tax Hikes: Swimming Against the Tide The UK is facing a cost of living crisis, with inflation at a 40-year high and energy prices soaring. Chancellor Rishi Sunak has been criticized for raising taxes, rather than cutting them, to help people cope with the cost of living crisis.

item.title: Covid Inquiry, Inheritance Tax, House Prices: The Readout
item.description: Key Issues in the UK News The UK news is dominated by a number of key issues in the coming weeks and months. These include: The long-awaited public inquiry into the UK government’s handling of the Covid-19 pandemic. The government’s plans to raise the threshold at which people start to pay inheritance tax.

item.title: The Respite Period For UK Housing Is Over
item.description: The UK housing market is showing signs of slowing down, with house prices stabilizing in May after a sharp rise in the fourth quarter of 2022. However, transaction volumes are falling, suggesting that further price falls are only a matter of time.

item.title: UK Headed for Mild Recession This Year
item.description: UK Headed for Mild Recession This Year According to Moody’s, the UK is headed for a “mild recession” this year. The recession is expected to be caused by higher-than-expected inflation and rising interest rates. Inflation in the UK is currently at a 40-year high, and interest rates have been raised four times since December.
